meanings.definition: To selfishly monopolize or keep something for oneself.
meanings.sent1: Tom bogarted all the cookies, not sharing with anyone.
meanings.sent2: She bogarted the swing at the park, not letting anyone else have a turn.
meanings.sent3: The cat bogarted the sunny spot on the windowsill, refusing to move.
meanings.sent4: The bully bogarted the best seat on the bus, making others stand.
meanings.sent5: He bogarted the TV remote, not allowing anyone else to choose a channel.

meanings.definition: To act in a cool, confident, and assertive manner.
meanings.sent1: James bogarted his way through the dance floor, impressing everyone with his moves.
meanings.sent2: She bogarted the meeting, taking charge and leading the discussion.
meanings.sent3: The detective bogarted into the room, exuding confidence in solving the case.
meanings.sent4: The actor bogarted the stage, captivating the audience with his performance.
meanings.sent5: The athlete bogarted the game, showing skill and determination in every play.

meanings.sent1: The older kids bogarted the playground, making the younger ones feel scared.
meanings.sent2: He bogarted his way into getting what he wanted, using threats and aggression.
meanings.sent3: The boss bogarted the employees, creating a hostile work environment.
meanings.sent4: The gang leader bogarted the neighborhood, instilling fear in everyone.
meanings.sent5: The dictator bogarted the country, ruling with an iron fist and suppressing dissent.
